channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Mary Ward
item.description: The man was allegedly detained and assaulted for failing to pay rent after getting into financial difficulty during the COVID-19 crisis.
item.title: Two charged after man detained, assaulted in Surry Hills for failing to pay rent

item.description: Real Madrid kept pace with Spanish league leaders Barcelona after a 3-0 win over Valencia highlighted by a double to Karim Benzema.
item.title: Stunning Benzema strike crowns Real win over Valencia

item.description: The 47-year-old Argentine said he planned the trip in just 24 hours after learning that flights to Argentina had been cancelled.
item.title: No flights, man sails across Atlantic to be with parents

item.dc:creator: Heather McNeill
item.description: Prosecutors finished putting forward their case against the accused Claremont serial killer in the Supreme Court of WA on Thursday, with attention now turning to defence counsel Paul Yovichâ€™s closing address.
item.title: As state's case draws to a close, Claremont defence takes aim at evidence

item.dc:creator: Marta Pascual Juanola
item.description: One of Perth's most vibrant suburbs has lashed out at the state government, calling them "shortsighted" over Metronet plans they say threaten to destroy the amenity of the area.
item.title: 'Sidelined' Victoria Park council on the warpath over Metronet sky rail plans

item.description: What happened overnight and what is ahead for the Australian sharemarket.
item.title: 8@eight: ASX set to inch lower after soft Wall Street lead

item.description: The Queensland government has capped political donations and election campaign spending under new rules that won't come into effect before October's election.
item.title: Queensland will cap political donations but not until after the election

item.description: The United States Tennis Association (USTA) announced this week that the US Open would go ahead in late August behind closed doors with strict health protocols.
item.title: 'This is very important': Djokovic hopes players can get to US Open

item.description: A day after US Trade Representative Robert Lighthizer told Congress he did not see decoupling the US and Chinese economies as a viable option, President Trump has responded.
item.title: 'Perhaps I didn't make myself clear': Trump renews threat to cut ties with China

item.description: India's External Affairs Ministry spokesman Anurag Srivastava said both sides agreed to handle the situation responsibly.
item.title: India seeks eased tensions with China after Himalayas clash

item.description: Advisers to the world's wealthy are urging them to hold more gold as they question strength of the share rally and the long-term impact of global central banks' cash splurge.
item.title: Flying to safety: The world's ultra-wealthy are stocking up on gold

item.dc:creator: Mary Ward
item.description: The man was initially charged last year, and now police have charged the 38-year-old over the alleged sexual touching of seven more alleged victims.
item.title: Sydney paramedic allegedly sexually touched victims while giving first aid at train stations

item.dc:creator: Lucy Stone
item.description: Jonathan Sri said police had confirmed they had dropped charges laid against him over a refugee rights protest in Kangaroo Point.
item.title: Police drop charges against Jonathan Sri

item.description: It's the latest action taken by media organisations to address employees protesting racial inequities in hiring as well as in coverage.
item.title: NYTimes, Washington Post back new diversity efforts after protests

item.description: The song is routinely seen and heard at Twickenham, with lyrics reproduced on walls at the stadium and sung from the stands.
item.title: England rugby union reviews use of fan anthem Swing Low, Sweet Chariot

item.description: Giant carnivorous dinosaurs the length of a bus wandered south-east Queensland about 160 million years ago, new research shows.
item.title: A bus-sized dinosaur roamed around southern Queensland

item.description: Wall Street in "wait and see" mode as it waits for the next big market-shaping move.
item.title: Mixed day on Wall Street amid COVID-19 spikes, muted data

item.description: The social media announcement came hours after the department said many officers failed to show up for work.
item.title: 'Higher than usual number' of Atlanta officers call out of work

item.description: Ray Dalio's Bridgewater is the world's biggest hedge fund - now it is warning of troubled times ahead as the economic effects of the pandemic linger.
item.title: Wall Street titan warns of 'lost decade' ahead for investors

item.description: With no truly safe bets during a wild year for financial markets, there's now a hunt to cover all eventualities and Japan's yen could offer a peculiar twin role.
item.title: Japan's currency could be the safest bet there is in an uncertain world

item.description: The ads showed a red inverted triangle with text asking Facebook users to sign a petition against antifa, a loosely organised anti-fascist movement.
item.title: Facebook takes down Trump ads over 'organised hate' policy

item.description: Chinese buyer enquiries for Australian homes fell to their lowest in almost three years in May,suggesting multi-billion dollar housing demand could be another casualty of a diplomatic spat between the two countries.
item.title: Chinese interest in Australian property shrinks as diplomatic rift grows

item.description: It's the quality of friends, not the quantity, that is the key to happiness. But what happens when you fall out with your soul mate?
item.title: Her affair was the final straw. Ten years later, I reached out

item.description: The easing of restrictions meant to stop the spread of the new coronavirus has accompanied new outbreaks around Florida.
item.title: Florida breaks previous daily record for coronavirus cases

item.description: The US Supreme Court has rejected Trump's effort to end legal protections for 650,000 young immigrants, his second stunning election-season rebuke from the court in a week.
item.title: Court rejects Trump bid to end young immigrants' protections

item.dc:creator: Jake Niall
item.description: Richmond coach Damien Hardwick says Dustin Martin should return next week, while dismissing the notion that the Tigers aren't the same team without 'Dusty'.
item.title: Dusty's absence not the reason for loss to Hawthorn: Tigers coach Hardwick

item.dc:creator: Lucy Cormack
item.description: A Brisbane artist said she wants her name known as the fifth alleged victim of indecent and sexual assault at the hands of prominent street artist Anthony Lister.
item.title: Brisbane artist speaks out as fifth alleged victim of Anthony Lister

item.dc:creator: Michael Dwyer
item.description: Rough and Rowdy Ways continues the gravity-defying trajectory of the artist's music during the past two decades.
item.title: Bob Dylan's new album will stand the test of time

item.dc:creator: Jennifer Duke
item.description: Shareholders and advocacy groups say research showing a female chief executive adds 5 per cent to a company's value bolsters the case for greater diversity in senior leadership ranks.
item.title: Female CEOs, directors boost company values: report

item.description: The NSW Minister for Planning and Public Spaces writes of his anger at being kept in the dark by Coalition colleagues in Canberra about the harbour's future.
item.title: My federal colleagues dudded NSW on Sydney Harbour

item.dc:creator: Simon Johanson
item.description: Chinese developer Poly is looking to offload a $500 million half share in two commercial office towers.
item.title: Poly puts two towers in play for $500m

item.description: The US ambassador to Australia writes of his heartbreak over George Floyd's death. He says friends such as the US and Australia rightly hold each other to high standards.
item.title: Remembering George Floyd in grief, outrage and a fierce desire to do better

item.dc:creator: Megan Gorrey
item.description: Live music shows in hairdressing salons and stand-up comedy in bookshops are among ideas being considered to reboot Sydney's after-dark economy.
item.title: 'Unexpected' events to revive Sydney after dark

item.dc:creator: Matt Dennien
item.description: Lord mayor Adrian Schrinner defends cutting the program to save $13 million, as 1500 people add their names to a petition calling for its reinstatement.
item.title: Brisbane council to reconsider scrapping of kerbside collections

item.dc:creator: Waleed Aly
item.description: Reconciliation isnâ€™t some gift to give magnanimously to Indigenous people, but something the nation as a whole needs for its own sake.
item.title: Lack of reconciliation remains our crowning failure

item.dc:creator: Fergus Hunter
item.description: Teaching, health, IT, engineering and science degrees will be cheaper than arts, commerce and law degrees under a federal government university funding overhaul.
item.title: Cost of priority degrees to be slashed, some fees to soar in funding overhaul

item.dc:creator: Charlotte Grieve
item.description: Hostplus' exposure to illiquid investments has come under pressure as its returns turned negative but Sam Sicilia is doubling down on the fund's venture capital push.
item.title: 'Ride it out': Hostplus CIO defends investment strategy

item.dc:creator: Tim Barlass
item.description: An increasing clamour of calls to wipe slave trader Ben Boyd off the NSW map has come after state environment minister Matt Kean said he would investigate replacing the controversial name.
item.title: 'Slap in the face': Calls to wipe slave trader Ben Boyd's name off NSW map

item.description: Just when it was looking as though social distancing might be helping to keep one pandemic at bay, another perennial plague rears its head.
item.title: The stain on both sides of politics is hard to remove

item.description: Every now and then I feel useless and worry I'm a fraud, but I have my own way of dealing with this.
item.title: Watching Trump makes me feel more competent at my job

item.dc:creator: Tom Rabe
item.description: A near $7 billion shortfall in funding for more than 20 election commitments has been identified in once-internal advice to the NSW government.
item.title: NSW warned of $7 billion infrastructure shortfall

item.description: Thirty years ago, seven AIDS activists were arrested outside the US Consulate protesting restrictions on travel by people who were HIV-positive.
item.title: From the Archives, 1990: AIDS demonstrators arrested at US consulate

item.dc:creator: Sam Downing
item.description: As a wise PT once told me: "You walk out of the gym with the posture you train with."
item.title: Stronger back, better posture? All it takes is four exercises

item.dc:creator: Lyn Maccallum
item.description: Breath test buses, National Trust book sale and saving the milko.
item.title: In the Herald : June 19, 1982

item.description: Trivia and word buffs: test your knowledge with today's superquiz and Target.
item.title: Target and superquiz, Friday, June 19

item.dc:creator: Samantha Hutchinson
item.description: Of all the distractions to come across the desk of a first-term MP, presumably, court action would be the least welcome.
item.title: Dave Sharma brings in big guns for defamation defence

item.dc:creator: Matt Wade
item.description: A ring of outer-Sydney suburbs are among the most reliant in Australia on JobKeeper.
item.title: The Sydney suburbs most reliant on JobKeeper

item.dc:creator: Tammy Mills
item.description: Victoria will be the only state or territory with a new way lawyers can charge fees for class actions.
item.title: Contentious class action fees pass in Victoria

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, June 19, 2020

item.dc:creator: Noel Towell
item.description: Court action could be a possibility as Victorian unions fight to retain their seat at Labor's table after the Somyurek branch-stacking scandal.
item.title: Andrews, Albanese face union backlash over Labor takeover
